content: Hi! Wondering what kinds of semver change is typically required if a crate's API doesn't change but all that's being added is documentation for public items as well as doc tests? TIA
Usually none. But one could argue about documentation changes that are specification changes that somehow could break users who actually follow specs.
Well, just remembered, Crates.io doesn't let you push without using an unused semver value, so you can't overwrite it
Has to be at least a patch version
That's assuming you want to put the documentation change on crates io immediately. But the documentation change itself doesn't require a semver bump.

I can agree with this, but only if it's specifically a change to an actual specification, or other usage instructions.
The 8472 said:

Usually none. But one could argue about documentation changes that are specification changes that somehow could break users who actually follow specs.

The 8472 said:

That's assuming you want to put the documentation change on crates io immediately. But the documentation change itself doesn't require a semver bump.

true
Thanks much to both of you! :+1:
